alert.note: Alert for Clay; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 18 at 10:39PM EDT until May 18 at 11:30PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Henry County in southeastern Alabama... Clay County in southwestern Georgia... Southwestern Randolph County in southwestern Georgia... * Until 1130 PM EDT/1030 PM CDT/. * At 1038 PM EDT/938 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located over Fort Gaines, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fort Gaines, Bellville, Days Crossroads, Harrisons Mill, Shorterville, Walter F. George Lock And Dam, Walter F George Lake, Standleys Store, Zetto, Watson Crossroads, Moores Crossroads, Pecan, Garnersville, Coleman, Jones Crossing, Bethel, Suttons Corner, Cotton Hill and Fort Gaines-Clay Airport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail and damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
